info.author: Rickard Sjoegren
info.description:
# darwin-pytorch

This is a small package for interfacing [V7Lab](https://www.v7labs.com/)'s annotation tool 
[Darwin](https://darwin.v7labs.com) with [Pytorch](https://pytorch.org/). 

## Quick start

### Install Pytorch

First [install your preferred version of Pytorch](https://pytorch.org/get-started/locally/) including `torchvision`.

### Install darwin-pytorch
Then use pip to install `darwin-pytorch`:

```
pip install darwin_pytorch
```

## Examples

### Loading annotations

`darwin-pytorch` provides a high-level wrapper around 
[`darwin-cli`](https://github.com/v7labs/darwin-cli) for 
loading datasets from Darwin. 

Example of authenticating and downloading an annotated dataset:

```
import darwin_pytorch
# Checks for DARWIN_PASSWORD environment variable, if this is not found the user
# will be prompted for password.
client = darwin_pytorch.DarwinClient('me@email.com')
data_path = client.download_dataset('dataset-name')  # Downloads data and returns root-path.
```

### Dataset

`darwin-pytorch` also provides a Pytorch `Dataset` wrapping a dataset downloaded from Darwin. Example use:

```
ds = darwin_pytorch.DarwinDataset(data_path)
ds[0]       # --> (PIL.Image, target-int)
ds[:2]      # --> [(PIL.Image, target-int), (PIL.Image, target-int))]
ds[[0, 3]]  # --> [(PIL.Image, target-int), (PIL.Image, target-int)]
```

**Please note**, so far only binary classification datasets are supported.

## License

`darwin-pytorch` is MIT-style license as found in the LICENSE file.

darwin-pytorch

This is a small package for interfacing V7Lab's annotation tool Darwin with Pytorch.

Quick start

Install Pytorch

First install your preferred version of Pytorch including torchvision.

Install darwin-pytorch

Then use pip to install darwin-pytorch:

pip install darwin_pytorch

Examples

Loading annotations

darwin-pytorch provides a high-level wrapper around darwin-cli for loading datasets from Darwin.

Example of authenticating and downloading an annotated dataset:

import darwin_pytorch

# will be prompted for password.
client = darwin_pytorch.DarwinClient('me@email.com')

darwin-pytorch also provides a Pytorch Dataset wrapping a dataset downloaded from Darwin. Example use:

ds = darwin_pytorch.DarwinDataset(data_path)
ds[0]       # --> (PIL.Image, target-int)

Please note, so far only binary classification datasets are supported.
